alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 3:14PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...POTENTIAL HEAVY RAIN AND STRONG WINDS FOR SE ALASKA FOR THE END OF THE WEEK... The Alaska Panhandle will be impacted by two separate systems this week. The first front on Thursday will bring heaviest rain fall to the NE Gulf Coast before advancing to the south and east through the night. Rainfall amounts of around 1 to 1.5 inches are expected from this system. After a short lull on Friday the second stronger low moves up from the North Pacific by Friday evening crossing over the region into early Saturday. This system will likely bring more heavy rain and stronger winds to some communities. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible. Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are likely with higher gusts also possible. Exact timing and track of this low are still uncertain. Residents should stay tuned to forecast updates and be prepared.
